intro: Saldanha illustris, commonly known as the illustrated saldanha, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves that often display vibrant coloration, particularly in response to light exposure. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, showcasing a range of hues from purple to white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its rarity and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
